name: inconvertible
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An inconvertible type of money cannot be easily exchanged into other types of money: inconvertible currency Inconvertible currencies were common in the period after World War 2. The country avoided being hit directly by the crisis because its currency was inconvertible.
More examplesFewer examplesFor more than two decades, the economy operated quite successfully with an inconvertible paper currency.These banks had the right to issue inconvertible banknotes.The institution lent long-term funds in convertible currencies which could be repaid in inconvertible currencies.

ECONOMICS unable to be changed into gold, another currency, or another type of investment: A large part of this amount was locked up in inconvertible securities.
